job_title: RN Case Manager in Ridgefield, CT
cons: The health insurance coverage isn’t great

pros: They give you cases based on what they think you can handle. You will be given a bonus of $20-100 if the case is too far or if they need it staffed quickly. Hourly pay is $2.75 more on weekends. You can choose which cases you want.
cons: If you do not have a car then the cases would not be too accessible. The app to clock in and out sometimes doesn't work. Home office is not available after 4:30 usually just an on call person, so if you want to speak to a supervisor you would have to call the next day. Supervisors are also not available on weekends.

pros: Super flexible, family oriented, new aged culture
cons: I have no cons for this agency

pros:
COVID preparedness and training were exemplary, I felt safe continuing to work
Direct supervisor is fair, available, and respectful
IT team is responsive and very competent
Field clinicians are unparalleled and supportive of each other
cons:
Top Heavy Organization
Documentation requirements are overwhelming
Productivity credits are not appropriately weighted to reflect time requirements
Inadequate number of per diem field clinicians on staff
Compensation is inadequate

pros: Great culture. Great place to work!
cons: Very faced paced if you are not used to that.

pros: Coworkers; generous PTO; nice location and beautiful building.  Nice programs for the community.
cons: Benefits are terrible for a non-profit; high turnover; recent restructuring- taking three positions and combining into one position. High stress and many unhappy employees with one foot out the door. Long hours with little pay to compensate. This is a non-profit that has lost its way.
